comments.body:
**Original author :** Magoni Bruno

Hi Xavier,

Sorry but I don't understand precisely what means backoffice menu to translate...

Thanks in advance for your precisions,

**Original author :** Mérour Xavier

Oops ! Seems the ticket was truncated. Sorry.

Here is ma proposal again : change some translation of the main back-end menu to reflect more what is inside.

My proposal ( for english & French )

Home / Accueil --> OK
Contacts / Contacts --> Users / Utilisateurs
Catalog / Catalogues --> Catalogs / Catalogues
Shop / Commande --> Shop / Shop
Services / Services --> OK
Map / Cartes --> OK
Monitor / Monitor --> OK
Dahsboard / Dashboard --> OK


What do you think ?

**Original author :** Magoni Bruno

Hi Xavier,

Contact has been choosen to aggregate "User" & "Organism" so I prefer keeping "Contact" terminolgy...

So in my opinion we could have:
Home / Accueil --> OK
Contacts / Contacts --> -Users / Utilisateurs- OK
Catalog / Catalogues --> Catalogs / Catalogues
Shop / Commande --> Shop / Magasin
Services / Services --> OK
Map / Cartes --> Maps / Cartes
Monitor / Monitor --> OK
Dahsboard / Dashboard --> OK

**Original author :** Portier Thomas

My opinion : 

Home / Accueil --> OK
Contacts / Contacts
Catalogs / Catalogues
Shop / Commandes
Services / Services --> OK
Maps / Cartes
Monitor / Monitor --> OK
Dahsboard / Tableau de bord

**Original author :** Mérour Xavier

I agree with the need to distinguish "user" and organisms" ;-)

For the SHOP in french, why not keeping "shop" as it is a usual term on the web even in French. Using only "commande" is restrictive" since you have in this menu also parameters (properties,...). I find the word SHOP reflects more its content.

**Original author :** Blatti Yves

Is the current terminology OK for you ? Can we close this issue ?

**Original author :** Mérour Xavier

What is your point of view TC ?

**Original author :** Portier Thomas

Not really important. Translations can be override for each platform. TC reject this issue.
